docs: Release v0.1.0 with comprehensive documentation and build automation

Release initial version (0.1.0) of Tasman Agentic Analytics, a local-first
notebook-driven analytics system. This release includes complete project
infrastructure, documentation, testing, and developer tooling.

Core features delivered:
- Local-first architecture with template-based SQL generation
- Rule-based query triage (search vs analysis classification)
- 6 pre-built SQL templates for common marketing queries
- Multi-role support (Marketer, CEO, CPO, COO)
- Automatic visualization with smart chart type detection
- LLM fallback support (OpenAI + Anthropic) with filesystem caching
- Read-only DuckDB connector with safety guardrails
- 20 comprehensive unit tests (100% passing)

Documentation added:
- README.md: Complete project documentation with v0.1.0 state section
- VERSION_0.1_STATE.md: Detailed state document (600+ lines)
- CHANGELOG.md: Semantic versioning changelog
- QUICKSTART.md: 5-minute setup guide
- VERSION: Semantic version number (0.1.0)
- .github/COMMIT_STYLE_GUIDE.md: Commit message conventions

Build system:
- Makefile with 10 commands (install, test, run, clean, etc.)
- Sample data generator (creates 20K+ row database)
- Complete uv-based dependency management
- pytest test suite with fixtures

Project structure:
- 16 Python modules (core, agents, tests, scripts)
- 11 configuration and documentation files
- 4 user roles with tailored KPIs
- 8-table database schema (3 facts, 5 dimensions)
- Interactive Jupyter notebook with 10 sections

Testing:
Run the following to verify this release:

1. Verify version number:
   cat VERSION
   # Expected: 0.1.0

2. Test Makefile commands:
   make help
   # Should show 10 available commands

3. Install and run tests:
   make install
   make test
   # Expected: 20 tests pass in ~0.5 seconds

4. Generate sample database:
   make sample-data
   # Expected: Creates ./data/marketing.duckdb with 20K+ rows

5. Verify database schema:
   ls -lh data/marketing.duckdb
   # Expected: File exists, ~1-2MB

6. Test notebook launch:
   make run
   # Expected: Jupyter launches at http://localhost:8888

7. Verify documentation completeness:
   cat README.md | grep "Version 0.1.0"
   # Expected: Version badge and state section present

   cat VERSION_0.1_STATE.md | wc -l
   # Expected: 600+ lines

   cat CHANGELOG.md | grep "## \[0.1.0\]"
   # Expected: Release entry found

8. Test cleanup:
   make clean
   # Expected: Cache files removed, no errors

9. Validate commit message style guide:
   cat .github/COMMIT_STYLE_GUIDE.md | grep "## Format"
   # Expected: Style guide sections present

10. Run comprehensive test suite:
    make test-v
    # Expected: All 20 tests pass with verbose output

    make test-cov
    # Expected: Coverage report shows core modules tested

Validation checklist:
- [ ] All 20 tests pass
- [ ] Sample database generates successfully
- [ ] Makefile commands execute without errors
- [ ] README.md renders correctly with version badges
- [ ] VERSION file contains "0.1.0"
- [ ] CHANGELOG.md includes v0.1.0 entry
- [ ] Jupyter notebook launches successfully
- [ ] Documentation is complete and accurate

Production readiness:
This v0.1.0 release is production-ready for:
- Search mode analytics queries
- Template-matched reporting
- Role-based KPI dashboards
- Exploratory data analysis

Not yet production-ready for:
- Analysis mode (planned Phase 2)
- Web API (planned Phase 2)
- Multi-user access (planned Phase 3)

For complete feature inventory and production readiness assessment,
see VERSION_0.1_STATE.md.

References:
- Implements requirements from claude-prompts/instructions-phase1.md
- Follows semantic versioning: https://semver.org/
- Changelog format: https://keepachangelog.com/
- Establishes v0.1.0 baseline for future development
